conversation.content: You think you've got it all [condescending] figured out, don't you, Detective Chen?

Well, I mean, the blood spatter patterns don't lie—and, uh, neither does the security footage showing you entering at 11:47. You're the only one with motive, access, and honestly, the skill set to pull this off.
Security footage? That's [laugh] rich! You know, I was, um, actually in Bangkok that night—ask anyone at the conference.
Bangkok? That's your alibi? We checked [frustrated] the flight manifests already! Your name appears on zero international departures that week—nice try though.
Maybe I used a different name.
A different name... right. So, er, you're admitting to identity fraud now? That's, you know, another felony to add to the list—and honestly, it doesn't help your murder case.
Murder? Who said anything about murder?
Nobody had to say it—the body [smiling speaking] speaks for itself. Actually, here's the thing, your lawyer called it an "unfortunate accident" but, um, accidents don't require seventeen stab wounds.
Seventeen? Your forensics team miscounted.
Miscounted? What are you, uh, [confused] suggesting exactly? Like, you know the real number? Because, I mean, that would be quite the admission right there.
I'm suggesting that [regretful] maybe you should check who trained your medical examiner.
Dr. Morrison has thirty years of experience—so, basically, she doesn't make those kinds of mistakes. The thing is, you're grasping at straws here, and, well, it's getting pathetic.
Pathetic? You know, that's, um, exactly what Victoria said about you—right before she, er, disappeared.
Victoria contacted you? When? She's been underground for three months—if you've been in communication, that changes everything!
Changes everything... Sure it does. Anyway, I guess you never, um, checked her sister's apartment in Queens, did you?
Her sister lives in Boston, [over confidently] not Queens! See, actually, this is how I know you're lying—every detail you give, well, it just proves how desperate you've become!
Boston? Hmm, that's interesting because, you know, I have photos of them together at, uh, that Vietnamese place on Roosevelt Avenue.
Photos can be doctored—timestamps can be faked! You're really reaching now, aren't you?
You want to know what's [bitter] really reaching? The way you've been, like, building this case on, basically, nothing but assumptions and, er, circumstantial garbage.
Circumstantial? We have your fingerprints on the [groan] murder weapon! I mean, that's pretty damn concrete—unless you're suggesting, well, someone borrowed your hands for the evening?
